result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal substances/street drugs/non-prescribed drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with J.D., M.B., A.P., RCU, D.D., B.K. or any known drug dealers/users.

Any conditions/programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample/pay surcharge.
Must give a complete and truthful statement to WCDTF/Chippewa Falls Law Enforcement about any illegal activity within his knowledge.  Must testify truthfully in any proceedings against any implicated individuals.  Truthfulness in his statement and/or testimony would be subject to a polygraph if the State deems necessary.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 16CF202 and 15CF1066.

on Amendment to Judgment of Conviction - ERP
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

Dated 04/19/19 from Department of Corrections Warden Jeffrey Pugh to Court regarding defendant's completion of programming and requesting authorization of the defendant's release and conversion of the remaining confinement time to extended supervision.
